snippet: The playwright and director Toshiki Okada talks about his trio of plays, "Hot Pepper, Air Conditioner and the Farewell Speech."
abstract: The playwright and director Toshiki Okada talks about his trio of plays, "Hot Pepper, Air Conditioner and the Farewell Speech."
lead_paragraph: A group of awkward temporary office workers wiggles, rambles and stumbles about in "Hot Pepper, Air Conditioner, and the Farewell Speech," three plays written and directed by the Japanese playwright Toshiki Okada. Presented by Mr. Okada's Chelfitsch Theater Company, the piece is being performed at Japan Society in a co-production with the Under the Radar festival.
